context_bundle.summary: Bash scripting best practices with shellcheck for linting, POSIX compatibility, error handling, and robust script patterns

common_patterns: Strict mode: 'set -euo pipefail # exit on error, undefined var, pipe failure'
Variables: 'name="value" # no spaces around =, ${name} for expansion'
Conditionals: 'if [[ -f "file.txt" ]]; then echo "exists"; fi # [[ ]] preferred over [ ]'
Loops: 'for file in *.txt; do process "$file"; done # quote variables'
Functions: 'function_name() { local var="value"; echo "$var"; } # use local for variables'
Error handling: 'trap 'echo "Error on line $LINENO"' ERR # catch errors'
known_errors: command not found: Check PATH, use full path or install command
syntax error: Run shellcheck, check quotes and brackets
permission denied: Add execute permission with chmod +x script.sh
variable not set: Use ${var:-default} for default value
word splitting: Quote variables "$var" to prevent splitting
shellcheck warnings: Fix issues reported by shellcheck for robustness
